sentence.Network_en: The president will accredit you as his assistant.

sentence.Network_cn: 我们把电灯的发明归功于爱迪生.

sentence.Network_en: Any accredit users can get relevant video information through the network.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何受权用户都可经由过程收集获得相干视频信息.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in sense 2): from French accréditer, from a- (from Latin ad 'to, at') + crédit 'credit'

entry.tran: 鉴定…为合格;确认…达到标准
entry.def: If an educational qualification or institution is accredited, it is officially declared to be of an approved standard.

example.ex: This degree programme is fully accredited by the Institution of Electrical Engineers.
example.tran: 这门学位课程经电气工程师学院鉴定完全合格。
布鲁内尔大学的一所正式学院

entry.def: If someone such as a diplomat or journalist is accredited to a particular job or place, they are officially recognized as having that job, or the right to be in that place.

example.ex: The President proposed that Russian diplomats could be accredited to NATO headquarters...
example.tran: 总统提议俄罗斯外交官可被派驻北约总部。

example.ex: Some of the organisations taking part protested that the delegates they had chosen were not being accredited.
example.tran: 一些参加的组织抗议他们所选出的代表未获委任。

sentences.sentence: "The Regents officially recognized the new educational institution"

means.word_mean: 2. provide or send (envoys or embassadors) with official credentials

sentences.sentence: "She was not properly credited in the program"

stems_affixes.word_buile: cred相信+ible能……的→adj.可靠的,可信的
cred相信,信任+ulous多……的→相信太多→轻信的
in不+credulous[adj.轻信的,易信的]→adj.怀疑的, 不轻信的
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
cred相信,信任+ential表形容词或名词→让人相信的东西→凭据
credulous[[adj.轻信的,易信的]]→n.易信, 轻信
cred相信,信任+it表抽象名词→ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分
ac给予+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→给予相信→委托
dis不+credit[ n.&v.信任;贷款;n.学分]→v.不信任,怀疑

means.word_mean: 官方认可, 接受或同意

sentences.en: They have the confidence of the governments to which they are accredited.
sentences.cn: 他们对其所代表的政府有信心。

means.word_mean: 把…归结于, 把…归咎于, 认为（某事为某人所说、所作）

sentences.en: The discovery of distillation is usually accredited to the Arabs of the 11th century.
sentences.cn: 通常认为，蒸馏法是阿拉伯人在11世纪发明的。

sentences.en: The president accredited Mr. Brown as his representative.
sentences.cn: 总统委托布朗先生作为他的代表。

means.word_mean: 委任，委派，派遣，派出(使节)

sentences.cn: 他被委任为驻东京的大使。

sentences.en: Our envoy was accredited to the new government.
sentences.cn: 我国已向该国新政府派遣了外交使节。

means.word_mean: 确认…达到(某规定的)标准，鉴定…为合格

sentences.en: Colleges may be accredited by regional associations.
sentences.cn: 学会是否合格可由地区各协会作出鉴定。

means.word_mean: 认为…具有某种特点，认为…属于

sentences.en: They all accredited him with the authorship of this book.
sentences.cn: 他们都认为他是这本书的作者。
